isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - DESCRIPTION - THROTTLE POSITION SENSOR (TPS)

svcproc.title: THROTTLE POSITION SENSOR (TPS)
svcproc.para: A transmission mounted throttle position sensor (TPS) is not used with electronic engines. Instead the throttle information is obtained from the engine ECM over the J-1587 communications link. The ECM receives this information from the electronic accelerator pedal. This information is then used to signal the power level of the engine to the transmission ECU. This signal is used to determine the timing of shifts by the ECU.
